706792f-b.title: Brooklyn: Shore Road - 99th Street
706792f-b.text:
(1)
Shore Road, east side, north of 99th Street, showing in the fore-
ground the house occupied in 1852 by General Stanton. (It was still
in the Stanton family in 1873). The follewing are families which
lived in or owned this house at one time or another; Walter E.
Shuttleworth in 1915, Major Thomas L. Johnson of Cleveland, Henry
George, George F. Gibson and William Stillwell. The center house is
No. 1085 Shore Road.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing only the first house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

706793f-a.title: Brooklyn: Shore Road - 99th Street
706793f-a.text:
(1)
Shore Road, east side, at 99th Street. The house at the left,
said to be the home of General Henry Stanton whose estate was bounded by
Shore Road, 97th and 99th Streets and Marine Ave.
1920.
Eugene L. Arniruster Collection.
MAr BE REPPODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing the Johnson house in the foreground, said to be
the Stanton house aodernised.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPPODUCED.
